item.title: Writing Recursively Defined Types in Rust
item.description: Let’s say we’re writing a theoretical compiler, and we want to teach it how to parse some math expressions. Consider this snippet of source code: (+ (- 20 10) 7) In this example, we see a math expression. The operator in this case is +, and the operands are another math expression and 7. Internally, the compiler sees these operands as just two more distinct expressions (literals are a type of expression).
